Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> TLDR: always cool stuff happening

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> This was well-written by CG in Pirate discord, and I am pasting it here:

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> ```

Just a reminder: If you want your privacy to stay private then never give out your address or transaction ID (txid) publicly.
While PIRATE provides you privacy, that privacy is lost when you intentionally give away your information.
Known information is traceable.
It has been proven that the comings and goings of know addresses and txids can be traced to other known points when they are spent.
While the amounts, etc. are still private, this can lead to someone tracking your "spending frequency", "income frequency", and links to other known addresses (that you may not even be aware of).
The specifics of the proofs will be coming soon (or you can read the discussion in the HUSH discord).

Again: If you want your privacy to stay private then never give out your address or transaction ID (txid) publicly.
```

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> TLDR: Do not share zaddrs or txids involving your zaddrs publicly, on social media/etc

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @jl777c yes, HushList has the concept of "public introducer zaddr", where you generate one new public zaddr just for introducing yourself to somebody else. The idea is that zaddr should never be used for anything else ever again, and GUI wallets need to be smarter to do that

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> a better middle ground is 1 public introducer per wallet, that is easier to manage

Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @gigamesh you can publish an address, just make sure to only use it to receive

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> for instance, if Z1 is your public tip address

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> DO NOT SEND FROM THAT ADDRESS

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Accept donations to Z1

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> then make a new zaddr no one has ever seen, send from Z1 => Z2

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> then send FROM Z2 to where-ever
